Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.

We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”

Job Description:
Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME)-level functional and behavior analysis, with a specific focus on Ground-based Midcourse Defense, within the Missile Defense Agency’s (MDA) mission area.
Develop advanced concepts integrating the Ground-Based Midcourse Defense (GMD) system with other, existing and emerging missile defense and Joint threat negation and command and control capabilities. Analyze emerging technologies to develop requirements for automated decision aids and threat-negation capabilities, as they relate to GMD.

Participate in a Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) environment to develop system-of-systems requirements via system/component trade studies and analysis. Document analysis results in reports and briefings for critique and review by SC&R and National Team stakeholders.
Create and present briefings within the team and to Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and supporting stakeholders. Work within, and may lead, a multi-disciplined team of 5-8 engineers in the execution of these tasks.

This position is in Huntsville, AL.
Note: Relocation costs are not offered for this position.
Education/ Experience:
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree (or higher) in an Engineering classification, mathematics or physics
20+ years of experience related to the job description
Active Secret Security Clearance with last investigation date less than 5.5 years
Strong technical background in requirements development and/or operational employment of the Ground-Based Midcourse Defense (GMD) system
Must be able to demonstrate knowledge of overall system behavior and functionality, experience with other related systems, and knowledge of emerging threat-negation technologies and decision aids
Demonstrated expertise in one more digital engineering tool areas used for requirements and/or architecture development
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced knowledge of all aspects of midcourse defense functionality
Experience in development and management of information exchange requirements necessary to support missile defense engagements
Knowledge of functional requirements to counter ballistic and advanced threat systems ((e.g., aero-maneuvering, hypersonic, hyper-glide, etc.), across a variety of systems a discriminator in selection
Experience in machine learning and/or artificial intelligence, interceptor, or kill-vehicle technologies
Requirements development or operational employment experience in multiple Elements of the Ballistic missile defense system conducting detection, tracking, engagement and assessment
Systems engineering experience with large, complex systems
Skills:
Skills:
Candidate must demonstrate ability to think critically and capture concepts in papers, presentations, and discussions. Individual must possess good communication skills.
Candidate must be capable of working both independently and within a small team environment.

Strategy & Analytics: Operating at the intersection of strategy and analytics, we combine these two disciplines to deliver exceptional value to insurance industry clients. Comprehensive management consulting experience: Proscendian consultants have experience solving challenging problems related to profitable growth, innovation, digital strategy, operational efficiency, capital management, product development, competitive analysis, technology, analytical capabilities, and talent acquisition.
